title: Striker WSL side remains undefeated following win over Taroona | The Advocate
body_text:
A long-range goal from Sam Hardy highlighted the Devonport Strikers' 7-1 win over Taroona in round four action of the Women's Super League.
Subscribe now for unlimited access.
or signup to continue reading
Despite praising the team effort, coach Mal Gorrie said there were plenty of good individuals performances throughout the contest.
"It's a good result and one we expected to get," he said.
"It was a good team effort and we had some good individual performances as well and multiple players got the goals today which was also pleasing.
"Jasmine White scored a hat-trick, Maddie Payne scored a brace and Mia Smith came off the bench and scored her first WSL goal, which was a proud moment for her.
"Sam Hardy was exceptional in the midfield and is contention for goal of the week for a strike from 30 yards out."
ALSO IN SPORT:
Gorrie said they had to change the way they played after half-time due to the weather.
"We scored early from our set pieces but when the weather changed it got windy and that changed our structures," he said.
"They stayed back, which we expected from the start, but they particularly did in the second half so we had to play some possession football to draw them out."
The Strikers WSL team now has a record of three wins and a draw.
In the NPL, the Strikers comfortably defeated Riverside 5-1, while the under-21 side recorded a 1-0 win against the same opponent.
In the Northern Championship men's competition, Launceston City put seven goals past Ulverstone in a 7-3 win, Burnie United won 4-2 against Launceston United, Somerset won a hard fought game against Northern Rangers 2-1 and the Strikers won 4-1 against Riverside.
In the women's Northern Championship competition, Northern Rangers won 12-0 against Somerset, Riverside defeated the Strikers 2-1, Burnie United kept a clean sheet as they were too good for Launceston United, winning 9-0 and Ulverstone recorded an 8-0 win over Launceston City.
